means: lay ： 指小心地把人或物平放或横放，侧重动作安稳。
place ： 较正式用词，指把某物放在一个正确的位置上，侧重动作的正确。
put ： 普通用词，含义较广泛。指把人或物置于某处，并将其留在该处。
set ： 普通用词，指为了某种目的而将人或物放在一定位置上。指物是多指立着放。

word_mean: 复位：骨折时的对线对位
定向：心理学中的定向心理，指由于以往经历，工作需要等使人易于以某种方式理解或反应

sentence.Network_en: We post up a set of rules for the house.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们张贴了一份房屋生活守则。

sentence.Network_en: Place the omelette under a gentle grill until the top is set.
sentence.Network_cn: 将煎蛋饼放在烤架下用文火烘烤，直到表面凝固。

sentence.Network_en: She conceded just three points on her service during the first set.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在第一盘自己的发球局仅失了3分。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 集合体分为集合 （Set）、多重集合（Multiset，具有相同集合值的集合）与列表（List）。类区间是集合体的一个特例，属于一个类 …
首页-★★秀客★★TOKYO STYLE-- 淘宝网 ... SHOES 鞋子 Set 套装 Coat 外套.
初一上册的英语单词表_百度知道 ... school 学校 set 套;组;副 of 表示所属.
九年级英语单词表_百度知道 ... put off 推迟；延迟 set 摆放；放置 set up 建立；创立；开办.

list.abs: 布景师(Set decorator) 249/每天(最低) 314/每天(平均) 教育工作者: 中小学教师 26,246-68,885 社会工作者(Social worker) 30,434-5.
动词加介词词组,._百度文库 ... off start off 出发 set off 出发 leave off 中断.
开字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 开除〖 expel;dismiss〗 开船〖 setsail〗 开创〖 start;found;initiate〗.
360教育网--最大的免费教育资源网 ... 25. businesswoman n. 女商人 26. set out 提出，制定出 27. on behalf of 作为……的代表.

jx.jx_en_mean: have a strong desire for or to do

lj.lj_ly: she &B{had her heart set on} going to university.

jx.jx_en_mean: display or show off one's abilities, attributes, or experience in order to convince someone of one's suitability for something

lj.lj_ly: he wanted to set out his stall as someone who would balance the books and create a firm financial situation.
lj.lj_ls: 他想要展现才能，让人知道他是能使收支平衡，能创造稳固的财政态势的人。

jx.jx_en_mean: hoist the sails of a boat
do something to begin a process or put a plan into action
(Brit.)make a determined attempt to win the affections of
cause someone to be in opposition or conflict with

lj.lj_ly: he hadn't meant any harm but his few words had set her against him.
lj.lj_ls: 他毫无恶意，但他的几句话使她敌视他。

lj.lj_ly: wives' allowances can henceforth be set against investment income.
lj.lj_ls: 今后妻子们的补贴可以用投资收益来抵消。

jx.jx_en_mean: give someone an air of unusual superiority

lj.lj_ly: his try-scoring ability and self-effacing modesty have set him apart.
lj.lj_ls: 他带球触对方端线的得分能力和谦虚精神使他鹤立鸡群。

jx.jx_en_mean: separate something and keep it for a special purpose

lj.lj_ly: there were books and rooms set apart as libraries.
lj.lj_ls: 有些书和房间留作图书馆之用。

jx.jx_en_mean: save or keep something, typically money or time, for a particular purpose

lj.lj_ly: the bank expected to set aside about $700 million for restructuring.
lj.lj_ls: 银行预计拨出七亿美元用于重组。

jx.jx_en_mean: annul a legal decision or process
delay or impede the progress of someone or something

lj.lj_ly: this incident undoubtedly set back research.
lj.lj_ls: 这一事件无疑阻碍了研究。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of a purchase) cost someone a particular amount of money

lj.lj_ly: that must have set you back a bit.
lj.lj_ls: 那一定让你花费了不少吧。

jx.jx_en_mean: stop and allow someone to alight from a vehicle

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English settan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zetten, German setzen, also to sit
late Middle English: partly from Old French sette, from Latin secta 'sect', partly from set
late Old English, past participle of set

encyclopedia.content: 深圳电子产品质量检测中心（以下简称SET）于1985年成立。是具有独立法人资格的公正检测机构，也是电子、信息、通信、医疗产品测试技术公共服务平台。经过20多年的奋斗，已成功获得了“国家级计量认证合格单位”、“中国合格评定国家认可委员会（CNAS）认可实验室”、“国家强制性产品认证（3C）指定检测机构”、“国家节能产品认证指定检测机构”、“高新技术产品成果鉴定指定检测单位”、“...

entry.def: A set of things is a number of things that belong together or that are thought of as a group.

example.ex: There must be one set of laws for the whole of the country...
example.tran: 整个国家必须要有一套统一的法律。

example.ex: I might need a spare set of clothes...
example.tran: 我可能需要一套备用的衣服。

entry.def: In tennis, a set is one of the groups of six or more games that form part of a match.

example.ex: Graf was leading 5-1 in the first set.
example.tran: 格拉芙第一盘以 5 比 1 领先。

entry.def: In mathematics, a set is a group of mathematical quantities that have some characteristic in common.

entry.tran: (一场音乐会中所演唱或演奏的)一组歌曲(或乐曲)
entry.def: A band's or musician's set is the group of songs or tunes that they perform at a concert.

example.ex: The band continued with their set after a short break...
example.tran: 短暂的休息后，乐队继续演奏他们的曲目。

example.ex: He plays a solo acoustic set.
example.tran: 他伴着原声乐器独唱了一组歌曲。

entry.tran: (经常碰面或趣味相同的)一伙(或一帮、一群)人
entry.def: You can refer to a group of people as a set if they meet together socially or have the same interests and lifestyle.

example.ex: He belonged to what the press called 'The Chelsea Set'.
example.tran: 他属于媒体所称的“切尔西圈子”里的人。

entry.tran: (话剧的)布景;(电影的)摄影棚，拍片现场
entry.def: The set for a play, film, or television show is the furniture and scenery that is on the stage when the play is being performed or in the studio where filming takes place.

example.ex: From the first moment he got on the set, he wanted to be a director too...
example.tran: 自从进入摄影棚的第一刻起，他就希望自己也能成为一名导演。

example.ex: ...his stage sets for the Folies Bergeres.
example.tran: 他为牧女游乐园剧院设计的舞台布景

entry.def: The set of someone's face or part of their body is the way that it is fixed in a particular expression or position, especially one that shows determination.

example.ex: Matt looked at Hugh and saw the stubbornness in the set of his shoulders...
example.tran: 马特看着休，从他坚挺的肩膀中看出了他的倔强。

example.ex: Artist Richard Stone has captured in her eyes and the set of her face her steely determination.
example.tran: 画家理查德·斯通在她的眼神和面部表情中捕捉到了她的坚毅和决绝。

entry.def: A set is an appliance. For example, a television set is a television.

example.ex: Children spend so much time in front of the television set...
example.tran: 孩子们花在看电视上的时间太多了。

example.ex: We got our first set — black and white — in 1963.
example.tran: 1963 年我们买了我们的第一台电视机——黑白的。

entry.def: If you set something somewhere, you put it there, especially in a careful or deliberate way.

example.ex: He took the case out of her hand and set it on the floor...
example.tran: 他从她手中拿过箱子，将它小心地放在地板上。

example.ex: When he set his glass down he spilled a little drink.
example.tran: 他把杯子放下时，饮料溅出来一点。

entry.def: If something is set in a particular place or position, it is in that place or position.

example.ex: The castle is set in 25 acres of beautiful grounds...
example.tran: 这座城堡坐落于一片方圆 25 英亩、风景秀丽的土地上。

example.ex: Quiberon is set on an eight-mile peninsula.
example.tran: 基伯龙位于一个 8 英里大小的半岛上。

entry.def: If something is set into a surface, it is fixed there and does not stick out.

example.ex: The man unlocked a gate set in a high wall and let me through...
example.tran: 那名男子打开了高墙中一面大门上的锁让我进去。

example.ex: Set into an alcove under the side deck is a tiny wash basin.
example.tran: 舷边甲板下面的一个凹处放了一个小小的洗脸盆。

entry.tran: 使处于(某种状态或情况)
entry.def: You can use set to say that a person or thing causes another person or thing to be in a particular condition or situation. For example, to set someone free means to cause them to be free, and to set something going means to cause it to start working.

example.ex: Set the kitchen timer going...
example.tran: 让厨房计时器开始计时。

example.ex: A phrase from the conference floor set my mind wandering...
example.tran: 会上发言者的一句话让我思绪飘远。

entry.tran: 设置，调整好，调准(钟表等)
entry.def: When you set a clock or control, you adjust it to a particular point or level.

example.ex: Set the volume as high as possible...
example.tran: 将音量尽量调大。

example.ex: I forgot to set my alarm and I overslept.
example.tran: 我忘了定闹钟,结果睡过了头。

entry.tran: 决定，确定(日期、价格、目标或水准)
entry.def: If you set a date, price, goal, or level, you decide what it will be.

example.ex: The conference chairman has set a deadline of noon tomorrow...
example.tran: 会议主席将明天中午定为截止日期。

example.ex: A date will be set for a future meeting...
example.tran: 将会确定将来会议的时间。

entry.def: If you set a certain value on something, you think it has that value.

example.ex: She sets a high value on autonomy...
example.tran: 她对自主权看得很重。

example.ex: If you set no value on being a woman yourself, how can you expect others to?
example.tran: 如果你自己都认为做女人一文不值，又怎么能期望别人尊重你呢？

entry.tran: 树立(榜样);创造(纪录);开创(先例)
entry.def: If you set something such as a record, an example, or a precedent, you do something that people will want to copy or try to achieve.

example.ex: Legal experts said her case would not set a precedent because it was an out-of-court settlement...
example.tran: 法律专家说她的案子不会成为判例，因为它是庭外和解的。

example.ex: A new world marathon record of 2 hrs, 8 min, 5 sec, was set by Stephen Jones of Great Britain...
example.tran: 英国的斯蒂芬·琼斯创造了新的马拉松世界纪录—— 2 小时 8 分零 5 秒。

entry.def: If someone sets you a task or aim or if you set yourself a task or aim, you need to succeed in doing it.

example.ex: I have to plan my academic work very rigidly and set myself clear objectives...
example.tran: 我必须严格地规划我的学业，同时给自己定下明确的目标。

example.ex: We will train you first before we set you a task...
example.tran: 我们在给你分派任务之前会先对你进行培训。

entry.def: To set an examination or a question paper means to decide what questions will be asked in it.

example.ex: He broke with the tradition of setting examinations in Latin.
example.tran: 他打破了用拉丁语出试卷的传统。

entry.tran: 安排好的;确定的;固定的
entry.def: You use set to describe something which is fixed and cannot be changed.

example.ex: Investors can apply for a package of shares at a set price...
example.tran: 投资者可以申购固定价格的股票组合。

example.ex: A set period of fasting is supposed to bring us closer to godliness...
example.tran: 据说定期斋戒会让我们更虔诚。

entry.def: A set book must be studied by students taking a particular course.

example.ex: One of the set books is Jane Austen's Emma.
example.tran: 指定阅读书目之一是简·奥斯汀的《爱玛》。

entry.tran: (戏剧、电影、小说等)以(某时或某地)为背景的
entry.def: If a play, film, or story is set in a particular place or period of time, the events in it take place in that place or period.

example.ex: The play is set in a small Midwestern town.
example.tran: 这出戏以中西部的一个小镇为背景。

example.ex: ...a 1964 science fiction novel by Philip K Dick, set in 1994 in a colony of humans on Mars...
example.tran: 菲利普·K.迪克 1964 年写的一部以 1994 年火星上一个人类聚居地为背景的科幻小说。

entry.def: If you are set to do something, you are ready to do it or are likely to do it. If something is set to happen, it is about to happen or likely to happen.

example.ex: Roberto Baggio was set to become one of the greatest players of all time...
example.tran: 罗伯特·巴乔注定会成为迄今为止最伟大的球员之一。

example.ex: The talks are set to continue through the week.
example.tran: 谈判可能会持续一周。

entry.def: If you are set on something, you are strongly determined to do or have it. If you are set against something, you are strongly determined not to do or have it.

example.ex: She was set on going to an all-girls school...
example.tran: 她执意要去女子学校上学。

example.ex: Margaret was always mischievous and set on her own individual course...
example.tran: 玛格丽特总是调皮捣乱，而且一意孤行。

entry.tran: 使表现出，显出(坚定的表情)
entry.def: If you set your face or jaw, you put on a fixed expression of determination.

example.ex: Instead, she set her jaw grimly and waited in silence...
example.tran: 相反，她一脸严肃，面部紧绷，一声不吭地等着。

example.ex: He came insolently towards Mr. Won, his features set in a scowl.
example.tran: 他傲慢无礼地朝元先生冲过来，面露怒容。

entry.def: When something such as jelly, melted plastic, or cement sets, it becomes firm or hard.

example.ex: You can add ingredients to these desserts as they begin to set...
example.tran: 这些甜点开始凝固时就可以加入辅料了。

example.ex: Lower the heat and allow the omelet to set on the bottom...
example.tran: 关小火让煎蛋的下面凝固。

entry.def: When the sun sets, it goes below the horizon.

example.ex: They watched the sun set behind the distant dales.
example.tran: 他们望着夕阳没入远处的山谷。

example.ex: ...the red glow of the setting sun.
example.tran: 落日的红色余晖

entry.def: To set a trap means to prepare it to catch someone or something.

example.ex: He seemed to think I was setting some sort of trap for him...
example.tran: 他似乎认为我在给他设什么套儿。

example.ex: They dug trenches in their path and set booby traps.
example.tran: 他们在小路上挖深沟设饵雷。

entry.def: When someone sets the table, they prepare it for a meal by putting plates and cutlery on it.
If someone sets a poem or a piece of writing to music, they write music for the words to be sung to.

example.ex: He has attracted much interest by setting ancient religious texts to music.
example.tran: 他因为给古老的宗教经书谱曲配乐而备受关注。

entry.tran: 为…做准备;为…铺平了道路
entry.def: If someone sets the scene or sets the stage for an event to take place, they make preparations so that it can take place.

example.ex: The Democrat convention has set the scene for a ferocious election campaign this autumn...
example.tran: 民主党代表大会已经为今年秋季激烈的大选作好了准备。

example.ex: The company has been setting the stage recently for progress in the US.
example.tran: 该公司最近一直在为美国的业务发展作准备。

entry.tran: 守旧的;一成不变的;固执的
entry.def: If you say that someone is set in their ways, you are being critical of the fact that they have fixed habits and ideas which they will not easily change, even though they may be old-fashioned.
If you set up a temporary structure, you place it or build it somewhere.

example.ex: They took to the streets, setting up roadblocks of burning tyres...
example.tran: 他们走上街头，用点燃的轮胎设置路障。

example.ex: 200 peace activists are planning to set up a peace camp at the border.
example.tran: 200名和平人士正计划在边界建一处和平营地。

entry.tran: 安装，装配，调试(设备或机器)
entry.def: If you set up a device or piece of machinery, you do the things that are necessary for it to be able to start working.

example.ex: Setting up the camera can be tricky...
example.tran: 调试相机可能会很费事。

example.ex: I set up the computer so that they could work from home.
example.tran: 我把电脑设置好，这样他们就可以在家办公了。

entry.def: If you set up somewhere or set yourself up somewhere, you establish yourself in a new business or new area.

example.ex: The mayor's scheme offers incentives to firms setting up in lower Manhattan...
example.tran: 市长的方案激励了打算在曼哈顿下城开业的公司。

example.ex: He worked as a dance instructor in London before setting himself up in Bucharest...
example.tran: 在布加勒斯特开公司之前，他在伦敦当舞蹈教练。

entry.def: If you set up home or set up shop, you buy a house or business of your own and start living or working there.

example.ex: They married, and set up home in Ramsgate.
example.tran: 他们结婚了，在拉姆斯盖特安家定居。

example.ex: ...20 businessmen hoping to set up shop in Japan.
example.tran: 希望在日本开店的20名商人

entry.def: If something sets up something such as a process, it creates it or causes it to begin.

example.ex: The secondary current sets up a magnetic field inside the tube...
example.tran: 二次电流在管子内部会产生磁场。

example.ex: This can help you satisfy the craving without setting up problems later on.
example.tran: 这可以帮你满足欲望，而且事后又不会惹出问题。

entry.tran: 使更健康;使更有活力;使状态更好
entry.def: If something sets you up for something, it puts you in a good condition or position to deal with it, for example by making you feel healthy and energetic.

example.ex: I have my cornflakes and smell the fresh air and the grass and it sets me up for the day...
example.tran: 我吃了些脆玉米片，呼吸着充满青草气息的新鲜空气，这让我一天都充满活力。

example.ex: The win sets us up perfectly for the match in Belgium.
example.tran: 这场胜利为我们在比利时的比赛鼓足了劲儿。

entry.def: If you are set up by someone, they make it seem that you have done something wrong when you have not.

example.ex: He claimed he had been set up after drugs were discovered at his home...
example.tran: 在他家里发现毒品后，他声称自己是被人陷害的。

example.ex: Maybe Angelo tried to set us up.
example.tran: 也许安杰洛想要陷害我们。

means.word_mean: 1. a group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used;
2. (mathematics) an abstract collection of numbers or symbols;

sentences.sentence: "the set of prime numbers is infinite"

means.word_mean: 3. several exercises intended to be done in series;

sentences.sentence: "he did four sets of the incline bench press"

means.word_mean: 4. representation consisting of the scenery and other properties used to identify the location of a dramatic production;
5. an unofficial association of people or groups;
6. a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way;

sentences.sentence: "the set of his mind was obvious"

means.word_mean: 7. the act of putting something in position;

sentences.sentence: "he gave a final set to his hat"

means.word_mean: 8. a unit of play in tennis or squash;

sentences.sentence: "they played two sets of tennis after dinner"

means.word_mean: 9. the process of becoming hard or solid by cooling or drying or crystallization;

sentences.sentence: "he tested the set of the glue"

means.word_mean: 10. the descent of a heavenly body below the horizon;
11. (psychology) a temporary readiness to respond in a particular way;

sentences.sentence: "the subjects' set led them to solve problems the familiar way and to overlook the simpler solution"
"his instructions deliberately gave them the wrong set"

means.word_mean: 12. any electronic equipment that receives or transmits radio or tv signals;

sentences.sentence: "the early sets ran on storage batteries"

means.word_mean: 1. put into a certain place or abstract location;

sentences.sentence: "Set the dogs on the scent of the missing children"

means.word_mean: 4. establish as the highest level or best performance;
5. put into a certain state; cause to be in a certain state;
7. make ready or suitable or equip in advance for a particular purpose or for some use, event, etc;

sentences.sentence: "I was fixing to leave town after I paid the hotel bill"

means.word_mean: 8. set to a certain position or cause to operate correctly;
11. adapt for performance in a different way;
12. put or set (seeds or seedlings) into the ground;

sentences.sentence: "the liquid jelled after we added the enzyme"

means.word_mean: 15. put into a position that will restore a normal state;
16. insert (a nail or screw below the surface, as into a countersink)
17. give a fine, sharp edge to a knife or razor
18. urge a dog to attack someone

sentences.sentence: "We put the time of arrival at 8 P.M."

means.word_mean: 21. get ready for a particular purpose or event;

sentences.sentence: "lay out the tools for the surgery"

means.word_mean: 22. alter or regulate so as to achieve accuracy or conform to a standard;

sentences.sentence: "correct the alignment of the front wheels"

means.word_mean: 1. (usually followed by `to' or `for') on the point of or strongly disposed;

sentences.sentence: "we are set to go at any time"
"with eyes set in a fixed glassy stare"
"his bearded face already has a set hollow look"- Connor Cruise O'Brien

means.word_mean: 3. situated in a particular spot or position;
4. set down according to a plan:"a carefully laid table with places set for four people";
6. determined or decided upon as by an authority;

auth_sentence.content: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.
auth_sentence.res_content: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.

auth_sentence.content: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
auth_sentence.res_content: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.

auth_sentence.content: Set aside in a warm place for ten minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Set aside in a warm place for ten minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Set aside in a warm place for ten minutes.

sentences.en: He set a cup on the table.
sentences.cn: 他把一个杯子放在桌上。

sentences.en: She set the food and drink before the guests.
sentences.cn: 她把食物和饮料放在客人面前。

sentences.en: to set the table for dinner
sentences.cn: 摆好桌子准备吃饭

sentences.en: She always set her hair by herself.
sentences.cn: 她总是自己做头发。

sentences.en: to set something at a high value
sentences.cn: 认为某物具有很高价值；极其重视某物

sentences.en: to set spies on a person
sentences.cn: 安插特务监视某人

means.word_mean: 致力于，一心一意要做(某事)

sentences.en: to set one's mind to a task
sentences.cn: 一心想着这项任务

sentences.en: to set one's gun
sentences.cn: 校枪

sentences.en: He always sets his watch by mine.
sentences.cn: 他总是以我的表为准对他的表。

means.word_mean: 使(面部表情、肌肉等)僵住

sentences.en: She looked at me, setting her face like a statue.
sentences.cn: 她面无表情，直直地瞪着我。

means.word_mean: 【桥牌】让(对手)宕牌，使(对手)完不成定约；阻止(对方)叫成定约

sentences.en: Only perfect defense could set four spades.
sentences.cn: 只有出色的防守才能打宕四黑桃的定约。

sentences.en: As the sun set, the shadows lengthened.
sentences.cn: 随着太阳的下山, 影子变长了。

sentences.en: It will be cooler when the sun has set.
sentences.cn: 太阳落山之后会凉快一点。

sentences.en: The cement will set in a few hours.
sentences.cn: 水泥几小时后就会凝固。

sentences.en: His star has set.
sentences.cn: 他的好运已不复存在了。

means.word_mean: (面部表情、肌肉等)僵住，凝住；凝结；凝固；(灰浆等)变硬，硬化；(颜料、染料等)固着，永不褪色

sentences.en: His face set when he heard such a word.
sentences.cn: 听到这句话，他当时就沉下了脸。

sentences.en: The concrete will set after a certain time.
sentences.cn: 过一段时间之后，混凝土就会硬化。

sentences.en: Long hair sets more easily than short hair.
sentences.cn: 长发比短发更容易卷成所需要的发型。

sentences.en: This set of the furniture is very good.
sentences.cn: 这套家具非常好。

sentences.en: These sets of machines were out of date.
sentences.cn: 这几套机器过时了。

sentences.en: I want one more stamp to complete my set.
sentences.cn: 我再有一枚邮票就凑成一套了。

sentences.en: Do you want to buy a television set?
sentences.cn: 你想买电视机吗?

sentences.en: Are you all set for the journey?
sentences.cn: 你们都为旅行准备好了吗?

sentences.en: He is set in his opinions.
sentences.cn: 他固执己见。

sentences.en: Ready! Set!
sentences.cn: Ready! Set!

jushi.chinese: 那件新连衣裙非常合适。

jushi.english: The apple blossom hasn't set well this year.
jushi.chinese: 苹果花今年没结多少果实。

jushi.english: Some kinds of concrete set more quickly than others.
jushi.chinese: 某些混凝土比其他混凝土凝结得快。
